intro: Mecardonia berroi, commonly known as the Berro's mecardonia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, yellowish flowers are followed by fluffy, seed-bearing structures that aid in wind pollination. Mecardonia berroi is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
